intro: Malvaviscus arboreus var. brihondus, commonly known as the Brazilian glorybower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in warm, humid climates.
